intro: Bulbine lamprophylla, commonly known as the golden bulbine, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a succulent perennial that belongs to the Asphodelaceae family. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that store water, and it produces clusters of yellowish-orange flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its ornamental value and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for landscaping in arid regions.
